io.spine.server.command

Annotation Type Assign


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Assign
    Marks a method as command handler.

    A command handler method must:

    • be annotated with @Assign;
    • return an event derived from Message or a List of messages;
    • accept a command message derived from Message as the first parameter.

    If the annotation is applied to a method which doesn't satisfy any of these requirements, this method is not considered a command handler and is not registered for command dispatching.

    A command handler method should have package-private access. It will allow calling this method from tests. The method should not be public because it is not supposed to be called directly.

    A command handler method may accept a CommandContext as the second parameter if handling of the command requires its context.

    IMPORTANT: an application must have one and only one handler per command message class. Declaring two methods that handle the same command class will result in run-time error.
